definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: I usually spent two hours in writing.
sentences.chinese: 我通常花兩個小時練字。

sentences.english: I practiced hard with my writing so that I could help the scribe copy minor documents for the principal.
sentences.chinese: 我用心的練字，爲是能幫助校長抄寫些不要緊的東西。

sentences.english: To practice calligraphy is the requirement of increasing the level of enforcing the law and solving the case.
sentences.chinese: 練字，是提高執法辦案水平的需要。

sentences.english: Therefore, the bad individual psychology can be corrected by training and practicing Chinese character writing.
sentences.chinese: 因此，可以通過練字訓練來矯正不良的個性心理。

sentences.english: Yan lived in a poor family when he was young and had to practice calligraphy on the wall by using mud.
sentences.chinese: 顏真卿少時家貧缺紙筆，用筆醮黃土水在牆上練字。

sentences.english: M: That’s not true! I think your calligraphy is very good.
sentences.chinese: 不錯，我很小的時候，我媽媽就逼着我練字。

definition: to recite or chant Buddhist scripture
to repeat a lesson/to learn by heart/to endorse a check
to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
